intro: Taeniophyllum trukense, commonly known as the Truk Islands moss, is a small, epiphytic plant belonging to the family Hypnaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and its ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments. The plant has simple, ovate leaves that are typically less than 1 cm in length. It is native to the Pacific Islands, particularly the Truk Atoll in the Caroline Islands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
